page.title: 16Bromham Hospital
page.content: Set in 200 acres of parkland,once the home of the Allen family,a residential hospital for 330 mentally handicapped people since 1949.Here the more disabled are encouraged in basic feeding and dressing skills whilst more able patients are trained to prepare them for life in the community such as use of the telephone,shopping, getting on a bus.Over the next 10 years more patients will be able to live within the community and numbers at the hospital will fall to 200. From January 1986 a new project here will house 16 severely disturbed patients in a "home-like" environment converted from 3 former staff houses.Some 500 full-time and part-time staff work here helped by the Parents and Friends of Bromham Hospital Association who fund-raise and whose volunteers are vital visitors and friends to patients
